discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. Start-up stage, initiation stage, and at least one other management stage to cover the remainder of the project

Explanation:

In PRINCE2, a project consists of at least two management stages:

1. Start-up Stage – Ensures the project is viable before committing resources.


2. Initiation Stage – Plans the project in detail and gains authorization to proceed.


3. At Least One Other Management Stage – Used to control and manage delivery, ensuring the project remains on track.



A PRINCE2 project must have at least one delivery stage after initiation, but larger projects may have multiple management stages. The closing stage is part of the final management stage and is not counted separately.

There are a minimum of two management stages in a project: the Initiation Stage and one further Management Stage. The Closing a Project process is then the last part of the 2nd Stage in a two-stage project. A PRINCE2 project is planned, monitored and controlled on a stage-by-stage basis.

Selected Answer: B
In PRINCE2, a project must have at least two management stages: 
• an initiation stage 
• at least one further management stage. The more complex and risky a project is, the more management 
stages will be required.

B. Start up stage, at least one other management stage to cover the remainder of the project and a closing stage

In PRINCE2, a project typically consists of the following stages:

Start-up stage: To initiate the project and prepare for the detailed planning.
Initiation stage: To establish the project's foundation, including the Project Initiation Documentation (PID).
Management stages: At least one or more management stages to cover the remainder of the project. The number of these stages depends on the project's size and complexity.
Closing stage: To formally close and review the project.
Therefore, a PRINCE2 project will always include the start-up stage, at least one management stage, and a closing stage.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. there should be at least 2 stages within a project.

choices.A: Start up stage, initiation stage and at least one other management stage to cover the remainder of the project
choices.D: Start up stage, initiation stage and a closing stage
choices.C: Initiation stage and at least one other management stage to cover the remainder of the project
choices.B: Start up stage, at least one other management stage to cover the remainder of the project and a closing stage

A.4.2: A checkpoint report includes a Work Package Tolerance status, used to assess how the execution of the work package is performing against its tolerances (e.g. cost/time/scope actuals and forecast).

questions.question_text: Which is a typical core activity within configuration management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Configuration management procedures can vary, but they typically comprise five core activities. The five core activities are:
Planning
Identification
Control Status Accounting and Verification
Audit
C may be correct
Configuration management is used to identify the different versions of products created during a project. In software development projects, this is usually denoted as v1.0, v1.1, v.2.0, etc.

Selected Answer: C
The three types of plan are: Project Plan, Stage Plan and Team Plans.

The Project Plan is used at the Direction Level and therefore is used by the Project Board. It is created during the Initiating a Project process and is a high-level plan for the whole project. It will show the major products of the project, when they will be delivered and the associated cost. It is a major control document for the Project Board. The Project Manager keeps the Project Plan up to date during the project.
The Stage Plan is used at the Management Level. It is created for each stage (e.g., for a period of 2 months), and is used by the Project Manager on a day-to-day basis. It is much more detailed than the Project Plan and just focuses on one stage.
The Team Plans are used at the Delivering Level. They are created and used by the Team Manager in the Managing Product Delivery process. The focus is to plan the work that is assigned to the Team Manager in Work Packages.

questions.question_text: Which is one of the three levels of plan in PRINCE2?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Only plans are showing Costs, timescale - Business case does not cover costs of the project

Selected Answer: C
The Plans theme involves creating detailed project plans that outline the activities, resources, time, and costs needed for the project. This is where the cost estimation is made.

Selected Answer: A
Business case: describes the justification for the project and the selected business option based on *estimated costs*, risks, and benefits. The purpose of the Project Plan is to provide confidence to the project board that the project *will fulfil its business case*. I believe the answer is A, because the Business Case's purpose is estimating costs.

Selected Answer: C
Although there are cost overlaps with the Business case Theme, the correct answer is C. Plan Theme. 

Section 9.3.1.5: ..."the cost of the resources and other costs calculated to produce the plan’s budget." The budget should include the cost of the project and management activities, the risk budget, the change budget, and cost tolerances. 
9.2.1.1: The project plan provides the planned project costs and timescales for the business case. The project plan is later used by the project board as a baseline against which to monitor project progress management stage by management stage.

Selected Answer: C
Option A, "Business Case," is not correct because the Business Case theme in PRINCE2 focuses on justifying the project and ensuring its continued viability and alignment with the organization's objectives. The Business Case outlines the reasons for undertaking the project, the expected benefits, costs, risks, and potential returns on investment.

While the Business Case does provide important information about the overall financial aspects of the project, it does not specifically focus on estimating the cost of delivering the project. The cost estimation and budgeting activities are carried out in the Plans theme, which is specifically dedicated to planning and controlling the resources, time, and costs required to deliver the project's products and services.

In summary, the correct answer is C. Plans, as it is the theme that deals with estimating the cost of delivering the project. The Business Case theme addresses the project's justification and its alignment with the organization's objectives.

Estimating costs is an essential part of the Plans theme. This process involves identifying all of the resources required to deliver the project, such as labor, materials, equipment, and any other expenses. The cost estimate should be as accurate as possible, based on historical data, expert judgment, and any other relevant information. This estimate is used to create the project budget, which is a key component of the overall project plan.

Once the cost estimate is completed, it is important to regularly monitor and control project costs throughout the project's life cycle. This ensures that the project remains on budget and that any cost overruns are identified and addressed as soon as possible.

In contrast, the Business Case theme focuses on justifying the investment in the project, considering the expected benefits, costs, and risks.

Selected Answer: A
Cost estimation is done in Business Case

The Business Case contains the following information: (source : Prince2.wiki)
- Reasons for doing the project as you would expect
- Estimate Costs and Timescale
- Benefits and dis-benefits (these are provided by the Senior User)
- Overview of project risks

Selected Answer: C
The Plans theme focuses on creating and maintaining plans that define how the project will be executed, monitored, and controlled. This theme includes the creation of a project plan, stage plans, and team plans, which include time, cost, quality, and risk management plans. The cost estimation is a key element of the project plan, and it is used to define the project budget and to monitor and control costs throughout the project. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Plans.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
The business justification (Business Case) for a project should include not only the costs of developing the products produced by the project but also any changes to operational costs post-project. Most organizations have policies that define how these costs should be accounted for in business justifications.

Selected Answer: A
A. Business Case
